title: Art, Literature, Film: Tuscan Identities from the Etruscans through Today
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: 8-week program: based in Siena, Italy. This course will critically examine the cultural identity of Siena, and more broadly, Tuscany, as manifested in its history, and the various art forms to which the city and region have given rise. Our entry points to this study will include literary and historical readings, on-site visits to Siena’s many artistic, religious, and political centers, cinematic representations of Tuscany, andas field trips to Florence, San Gimignano, Pisa, and the Tuscan countryside – as well as Rome. Particular attention will be devoted to the defining ritual of Sienese life: Il Palio, the splendid medieval horse race run in the city's central Piazza del Campo. Must be taken in conjunction with ITAL S110 and ITAL S120. Enrollment limited. Application deadline: February 15. Students are responsible for arranging travel to and from Siena and all other program expenses beyond tuition. For further details, such as program costs, exact dates, credits, etc., visit the <a href="http://studyabroad.yale.edu/programs/elementary-italian-i-ii"; target="_blank">program page</a> on the Yale Study Abroad website.
